intro: Ochrosia ackeringae var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ochrosia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its strap-shaped, narrow leaves and clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under the canopy of rainforests. Its botanical features include a bulbous root system and showy inflorescences that bloom during the warmer months. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
